intro: Eudema, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have rhizomatous growth and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. They are often found in woodland habitats and can thrive in partial shade. Eudema species are generally herbaceous perennials with a distinctive appearance that makes them popular in ornamental gardening.
